abstract: Multinationals have a bad record of job growth in the United States. Given his company’s views on corporate tax policy and job creation, what will Jeffrey Immelt of General Electric bring to the table?
snippet: Multinationals have a bad record of job growth in the United States. Given his company’s views on corporate tax policy and job creation, what will Jeffrey Immelt of General Electric bring to the table?
lead_paragraph: In the wake of Jeffrey Immelt‘s ascent to the chairmanship of President Obama‘s jobs council, some commentators have questioned whether the leader of General Electric, a company that has sharply reduced its United States payrolls over the years, is the best person to be orchestrating a jobs revival.

headline.main: Is a Multinational C.E.O. the Best Jobs Czar?
